title: ÁæéÂõΩË∞àËÆ∫"È´òÂ∫¶ÊàíÂ§áÁä∂ÊÄÅ"ÔºåÂæ∑ÈªëÂÖ∞ËÆ§‰∏∫ËøôÊòØ"Ë∞àÂà§Á≠ñÁï•" | Êñ∞Èóª | ÂçäÂ≤õÁîµËßÜÂè∞
text:
„ÄäÂçéÁõõÈ°øÈÇÆÊä•„ÄãÊè¥ÂºïÊ∂àÊÅØ‰∫∫Â£´ÁöÑËØùËØ¥ÔºåÁæéÂõΩÂú®Êï¥‰∏™‰∏≠‰∏úÂú∞Âå∫ÁöÑÂ§ß‰ΩøÈ¶ÜÂíåÂÜõ‰∫ãÂü∫Âú∞Â∑≤ËøõÂÖ•È´òÂ∫¶ÊàíÂ§áÁä∂ÊÄÅÔºå‰ª•Èò≤‰ª•Ëâ≤ÂàóÂèØËÉΩÂØπ‰ºäÊúóÂèëÂä®Ë¢≠Âáª„ÄÇ‰ºäÊúóÈÄöËøáÂÖ∂‰∏ÄÂêçÂÆòÂëòÂõûÂ∫îÁß∞ÔºåÂçéÁõõÈ°øÁöÑÂÅöÊ≥ïÊòØ‚ÄúË∞àÂà§Á≠ñÁï•ÁöÑ‰∏ÄÈÉ®ÂàÜ‚Äù„ÄÇ
ËØ•Êä•Êè¥ÂºïËØ•Âú∞Âå∫‰∏ÄÂêçÂ§ñ‰∫§ÂÆòÁöÑËØùËØ¥ÔºåÁæéÂõΩÊ≠£Âú®ÂÖ≥Ê≥®‚ÄúÂ±ÄÂäøÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ËÆ§‰∏∫Â±ÄÂäøÊØî‰ª•ÂæÄ‰ªª‰ΩïÊó∂ÂÄôÈÉΩÊõ¥Âä†Âç±Èô©‚Äù„ÄÇÊä•ÈÅìËøòÊè¥ÂºïÊ∂àÊÅØ‰∫∫Â£´ÁöÑËØùÁß∞Ôºå‚ÄúÁæéÂõΩÊÉÖÊä•ÂÆòÂëòË∂äÊù•Ë∂äÊãÖÂøÉ‰ª•Ëâ≤ÂàóÂú®Êú™ÁªèÂçéÁõõÈ°øÊâπÂáÜÁöÑÊÉÖÂÜµ‰∏ãË¢≠Âáª‰ºäÊúó„ÄÇ‚Äù
ÈòÖËØªÊõ¥Â§ö list of 4 items list 1 of 4 ‰øÑ‰πåÊàò‰∫âÔºöÁ¨¨1204Â§©ÂÖ≥ÈîÆ‰∫ã‰ª∂Ê¶ÇËø∞ list 2 of 4 ÂÆòÂëòÔºöÁæéÂõΩÂõΩÊ∞ëË≠¶Âç´Èòü‚ÄúÈ¢ÑËÆ°ÁßªÊ∞ëÊäóËÆÆÊ¥ªÂä®Â∞ÜÂçáÁ∫ß‚Äù list 3 of 4 ‰ª•Ëâ≤ÂàóÂØπÂä†Ê≤ôÊàò‰∫âÁöÑ‰ªäÊó•ÂèëÂ±ïÔºö‰ª•ÂÜõË¢≠ÂáªÂä†Ê≤ôÂØªÊ±ÇÊè¥Âä©ËÄÖÂπ∂ÈÄ†Êàê13‰∫∫Ê≠ª‰∫°„ÄÅ200‰∫∫Âèó‰º§ list 4 of 4 ÁæéÂõΩ‰∏é‰ºäÊúóÁ¥ßÂº†ÂÖ≥Á≥ªÔºöÂú®Âæ∑ÈªëÂÖ∞ÂèëÂá∫Â®ÅËÉÅÂêéÔºåÂçéÁõõÈ°øÂáÜÂ§áÊí§Á¶ªËØ•Âú∞Âå∫‰∫∫Âëò end of list ÁæéÂõΩÂì•‰º¶ÊØî‰∫öÂπøÊí≠ÂÖ¨Âè∏Êñ∞ÈóªÁΩëÊè¥ÂºïÊ∂àÊÅØ‰∫∫Â£´ÁöÑËØùÁß∞ÔºåÁæéÂõΩÂÆòÂëòÂ∑≤Ëé∑ÊÇâÔºå‰ª•Ëâ≤ÂàóÂ∑≤ÂÅöÂ•ΩÂÖÖÂàÜÂáÜÂ§áÂØπ‰ºäÊúóÂèëÂä®ÂÜõ‰∫ãË°åÂä®ÔºåÂçéÁõõÈ°øÈ¢ÑËÆ°‰ºäÊúóÂ∞Ü‰ª•Ë¢≠ÂáªÁæéÂõΩÂú®‰ºäÊãâÂÖãÁöÑÂÜõ‰∫ãÂü∫Âú∞‰Ωú‰∏∫ÂõûÂ∫î„ÄÇ
Âú®Ê≠§ËÉåÊôØ‰∏ãÔºåÁæéÂõΩÂõΩÂä°Èô¢ÂèëÂ∏É‰∫ÜÂõõÁ∫ß‰ºäÊãâÂÖãÊóÖË°åË≠¶ÂëäÔºåÁêÜÁî±ÊòØÂÖ∂ÊâÄË∞ìÁöÑ‚ÄúÊÅêÊÄñ‰∏ª‰πâ„ÄÅÊ≠¶Ë£ÖÂÜ≤Á™ÅÂíåÂÜÖ‰π±‚Äù„ÄÇ

ÁâπÊúóÊôÆÂú®Âè¶‰∏Ä‰ªΩÂ£∞Êòé‰∏≠Ë°®Á§∫Ôºå‰ªñ‚ÄúÊØî‰ª•ÂæÄ‰ªª‰ΩïÊó∂ÂÄôÈÉΩÊõ¥Êúâ‰ø°ÂøÉÔºåÁæéÂõΩÂÜõÈòüÂ∞ÜÂú®Êú™Êù•ÁöÑÊó•Â≠êÈáåÂÜçÂàõËæâÁÖå‚ÄùÔºå‰ΩÜ‰ªñÊ≤°ÊúâËØ¥ÊòéËøôÊòØ‰ªÄ‰πàÊÑèÊÄù„ÄÇ
ÁæéÂõΩÊúâÁ∫øÁîµËßÜÊñ∞ÈóªÁΩëÔºàCNNÔºâÊè¥ÂºïÊ∂àÊÅØ‰∫∫Â£´ÁöÑËØùÁß∞ÔºåÁâπÊúóÊôÆÁü•ÊôìÊúÄËøëÁöÑ‰∏æÂä®ÔºåÁæéÂõΩ‰∏≠Â§ÆÂè∏‰ª§ÈÉ®Ê≠£Âú®ÁõëËßÜ‰∏≠‰∏úÂú∞Âå∫ÁöÑÁ¥ßÂº†Â±ÄÂäø„ÄÇËØ•ÁîµËßÜÂè∞ËøòÁß∞Ôºå‰ªñÂú®Âë®‰∏Ä‰∏é‰ª•Ëâ≤ÂàóÊÄªÁêÜÊú¨ÈõÖÊòé¬∑ÂÜÖÂ°îÂ∞º‰∫öËÉ°ÁöÑÈÄöËØù‰∏≠Ë¶ÅÊ±Ç‰ªñÂÅúÊ≠¢Ë∞àËÆ∫Ë¢≠Âáª‰ºäÊúó„ÄÇ
Ê≠§ÂâçÔºå‰∏ÄÂêçÁæéÂõΩÂõΩÈò≤ÂÆòÂëòÂëäËØâÂçäÂ≤õÁîµËßÜÂè∞Ôºå‰∏≠Â§ÆÂè∏‰ª§ÈÉ®Ê≠£Âú®ÂÖ≥Ê≥®‰∏≠‰∏úÂú∞Âå∫ÁöÑÁ¥ßÂº†Â±ÄÂäøÔºåÂπ∂ËØÅÂÆûÂõΩÈò≤ÈÉ®ÈïøÁöÆÁâπ¬∑Ëµ´Ê†ºÂ°ûÊñØÂ∑≤ÊâπÂáÜÂÜõ‰∫∫ÂÆ∂Â±ûËá™ÊÑøÊí§Á¶ª‰∏≠Â§ÆÂè∏‰ª§ÈÉ®Âå∫ÂüüÂÜÖÁöÑÂêÑ‰∏™Âú∞ÁÇπ„ÄÇ
ÁæéËÅîÁ§æÊè¥ÂºïÁæéÂõΩÂÆòÂëòÁöÑËØùËØ¥ÔºåÁæéÂõΩÂõΩÂä°Èô¢Ê≠£ÂáÜÂ§áÂèëÂ∏ÉÂëΩ‰ª§ÔºåË¶ÅÊ±ÇÊâÄÊúâÈùûÂøÖË¶ÅÁöÑÁæéÂõΩÂ§ß‰ΩøÈ¶Ü‰∫∫ÂëòÂèäÂÖ∂ÂÆ∂Â±ûÁ¶ªÂºÄÂ∑¥Ê†ºËææ„ÄÅÂ∑¥ÊûóÂíåÁßëÂ®ÅÁâπ„ÄÇ
Âè¶‰∏ÄÊñπÈù¢ÔºåË∑ØÈÄèÁ§æÊè¥Âºï‰ºäÊúóÂÆòÂëòÁöÑËØùÁß∞ÔºåÂÜõ‰∫ãÂ®ÅËÉÅ‰∏ÄÁõ¥ÊòØÁæéÂõΩÂØπ‰ºäË∞àÂà§Á≠ñÁï•ÁöÑ‰∏ÄÈÉ®ÂàÜÔºåÂπ∂Ë≠¶ÂëäÁß∞Ôºå‚Äú‰ªª‰ΩïÈíàÂØπÊàë‰ª¨ÁöÑÂÜõ‰∫ãË°åÂä®ÔºåÊó†ËÆ∫ÊòØÁæéÂõΩËøòÊòØ‰ª•Ëâ≤ÂàóÔºåÈÉΩÂ∞ÜÂ∏¶Êù•ÂèØÊÄïÁöÑÂêéÊûú‚Äù„ÄÇ

author: Naomi Clarke, PA Senior Entertainment Reporter
title: Leah Remini announces divorce from husband after 21 years of marriage
text:
Leah Remini announces divorce from husband after 21 years of marriage Leah Remini is to divorce her husband of 21 years (Ian West/PA)
Fri, 30 Aug, 2024 - 09:29 Naomi Clarke, PA Senior Entertainment Reporter ÔÇö Ôà≤
ÔÖÇ ÔÉ° ÔäÅ ÔÉ† American actress Leah Remini has announced her and husband Angelo Pagan are divorcing after 21 years of marriage.
In a joint Instagram post, the King of Queens star said the decision came after ‚Äúa lot of thought and care‚Äù but they decided to part ways as they have ‚Äúboth changed‚Äù as people.
The couple, who share a daughter Sofia and have documented their lives in a number of TV documentaries and reality shows, said they hope to ‚Äúinspire others to see that relationships ‚Äî whether they change or end ‚Äî aren‚Äôt failures‚Äù.
Alongside a photo of the pair in their early days and more recently, Remini wrote: ‚ÄúWell, here we are. After 28 years together and 21 years of marriage, we have decided to file for divorce.
‚ÄúThis decision came after a lot of thought and care, and as hard as divorce is, we are approaching this with a positive outlook because we know it‚Äôs what‚Äôs best for us.
‚ÄúWe are proud of how we have worked through this together. Yes, we‚Äôre sad, and we‚Äôve got some figuring out to do as we continue to move forward into our new normal‚Äîtogether still in many ways, and apart in some new ones.
‚ÄúBut here‚Äôs the thing: we‚Äôve been best friends for so many years. We are still celebrating holidays together, watching our favourite TV shows together, and gathering as a family.
‚ÄúSo, the big question‚Äî why? To put it simply, we both changed, as people do, and we got used to playing roles that didn‚Äôt fit us any more.
‚ÄúAfter a lot of effort and consideration, we‚Äôve decided to take this step, which reflects who we are today.‚Äù
The actress said they feel their marriage is one to celebrate after creating ‚Äúmany beautiful memories‚Äù and producing their ‚Äúincredible daughter‚Äù.
She explained they wanted to be transparent about the change in their relationship after being open about it over the years.
Their wedding in 2003 was captured in the documentary VH1 Inside Out: Leah Remini‚Äôs Wedding Special, with a following one released the year after to document the birth of their daughter.
Leah Remini and Angelo Pagan (Alamy/PA)
‚ÄúWe are sharing this unknown territory with you all as we take our first steps into this next stage of our lives publicly,‚Äù she said.
‚ÄúWe would love for everyone to have more access to different kinds of relationship stories and not feel so isolated in navigating the changes that millions of couples make every year.
‚ÄúWe hope our journey can inspire others to see that relationships ‚Äî whether they change or end ‚Äî aren‚Äôt failures. We‚Äôll keep sharing snippets of our lives as we navigate this new chapter.‚Äù
They signed off the statement by writing: ‚ÄúLove, Leah & Angelo.‚Äù
Remini is best known for starring as Carrie Heffernan in US sitcom The King Of Queens and as Vanessa Cellucci in Kevin Can Wait.
The actress has also been outspoken about her experience with The Church of Scientology and she won two Emmy Awards for her series, Leah Remini: Scientology and the Aftermath, which explored her time with the organisation.
She filed a lawsuit against the organisation and its leader David Miscavige last year, saying in a statement that she had endured 17 years of ‚Äúpsychological torture, defamation, surveillance, harassment, and intimidation‚Äù which had ‚Äúsignificantly‚Äù impacted her life and career.
The Church of Scientology described the lawsuit as ‚Äúludicrous‚Äù and her allegations as ‚Äúpure lunacy‚Äù.

author: VideoElephant
title: Millions of U.S. workers will see a pay increase in 2024
text: At the start of the new year, 22 states and 43 cities and counties are increasing the hourly minimum wage, benefiting nearly 10 million people. author: complex.com
title: Swizz Beatz and Alicia Keys Announce Art Collection Exhibit at Brooklyn Museum | Complex
text:
Swizz Beatz and Alicia Keys Announce Their Art Collection Exhibit at Brooklyn Museum Swizz began collecting art in the ‚Äô90s and has over a thousand pieces.
By Mark Elibert Jan 05,
(Photo by Gotham / Getty Images)
(Photo by Gotham / Getty Images) Swizz Beatz and Alicia Keys have announced they'll be showing off pieces of their rare art collection with a brand new installment at the Brooklyn Museum .
On Friday, the couple shared a post on their respective Instagram pages announcing the news of their collaboration with the famous NYC museum. In their post, the Deans are sitting in front of some of their paintings and other images of them, as well as the artists whose art they have in their collection. Swizz held a seat on the museum's board from 2015 until last October. News of the exhibition's existence was shared back in November 2023.
"Been holding this incredible news close to the chest," the couple wrote in their caption. "Now, it's our pleasure to officially announce GIANTS: Art from the Dean Collection of Swizz Beatz and Alicia Keys opening on February 10 @brooklynmuseum ! Tickets to #GiantsBkM available now A MUST SEE SHOW. Link in bioüí•üí•üí• Let's get 2024 started!!üíú A BIG special thank you to all the GIANTS in the show!!! @TheDeanCollection ."
View this photo on Instagram Instagram: @aliciakeys Kimberli Gant, a curator of modern and contemporary art who helped organize the installment, told the New York Times that, "There is great brand recognition with the Deans, but they don't know them as collectors."
Swizz has been collecting artwork since the ‚Äô90s and most recently revealed to the Times that his collection has easily hit the thousands mark with various rare pieces, including a 2018 Derrick Adams painting titled "Floater 74," which will be on view at the exhibition.
Most of the work in their collection is from African-American artists, which Swizz said wasn't easy because there wasn't a market for it. "The reason why we doubled down on African American art is because people weren't collecting it. Things flow a little better now," he said.

author: Matthew Allard ACS
title: Corrupted images captured with EOS R5 Mark II and certain SanDisk SD cards
text:
Canon USA has released a statement on its website about corrupted recordings when using certain SanDisk SD cards in the Canon R5 Mark II .
The cards that are not compatible are the SanDisk Extreme PRO SDXC UHS-II 64GB, 128GB, and 256GB V60 cards.
I cannot stress this enough, make sure you use approved media in your cameras that has been tested by the camera manufacturer! If you don‚Äôt you are playing Russian Roulette. This is exactly the reason camera manufacturers put out these lists in the first place. While using media on an approved list is no guarantee, it is one step closer to making sure you don‚Äôt have any issues.
Below is what the statement from Canon USA says in full:
Thank you for choosing Canon products.
Still images taken with Canon EOS R5 Mk II may be recorded as corrupted/abnormal due to incompatibility of certain SanDisk Extreme PRO SDXC UHS-II 64GB, 128GB and 256GB V60 cards.
For more information, please see the link to SanDisk support:
Steps to Resolve SanDisk Extreme PRO¬Æ SDXC‚Ñ¢ UHS-II V60 64, 128, and 256GB Still Image Problem with a Canon EOS R5 Mark II | SanDisk
To learn about compatible SanDisk Memory Cards for EOS R5 Mark II, please visit the below link.
Learn About Compatible SanDisk Memory Cards for the Canon EOS R5 Mark II Camera | SanDisk
Below I have listed what cards are compatible and have been tested by Canon for use with the R5 Mark II.
This information is only for residents of the United States and its five territories. If you do not reside within these areas, please contact the Canon Customer Support Center in your region.
Thank You,
Service Strategy & Support Group
Canon U.S.A., Inc
Contact Information for Inquiries
Canon Customer Support Center
Phone: 1-800-OK-CANON / 1-800-652-2666
TDD: 1-855-270-3277

author: Ryan Kailath
title: 7 things to do in NYC this weekend with non-exhausting levels of crowds and tourists
text:
This week is utter and total pandemonium in many pockets of the city.
Austinites like to leave town during SXSW. New Orleanians near the parade grounds rent out their houses during Jazz Fest.
But what do New Yorkers do if they‚Äôre in town the week between Christmas and New Year‚Äôs? No matter how you try to warn them, visitors always want to see the tree or Central Park, or walk the Brooklyn Bridge ‚Ä¶ along with the millions of other holiday visitors.
While we can‚Äôt predict the future, here are some ideas for enjoying this week without the worst of the crowds.
Get tonkatsu and go to Tomi Jazz
Okay, this is definitely still Midtown. But if you‚Äôve been dragged out to brave the tree at Rockefeller Center or have a stop at Grand Central, head east for some of the best Japanese food in the city.
Katsu-Hama‚Äôs panko-crusted Berkshire pork loin is incredibly light and tender, and their katsu curry and katsudon are also standout options. Nearby Totto Ramen and Okatte Tanto are among the neighborhood‚Äôs many offerings. Afterward, a stop at Tokyo-style speakeasy Bar Orai (21+) or Tomi Jazz (kids welcome) should help you settle down from the day.
Eat in Sunset Park Chinatown before braving the Dyker Heights lights
Okay, holiday crowds aren‚Äôt limited to Midtown. But if you want to avoid a hurried, hangry walk ‚Äì or worse yet, a standstill drive ‚Äì through the
light display in Dyker Heights, stop off in Sunset Park along the way for regional Chinese options, including standout Cantonese dim sum houses like East Harbor Seafood or Golden Imperial.
